name: Forget-me-nots
description: pink-budded, sky-blue flowered, found in woods and in scree.

name: Narcissi (Photo by Pa)
description: pdissect into sepals, petals, corona, stamen, anthers and spathe

name: Jasmine Flowers
description: collect at dusk to make fragrant infused tea.

name: Earthworm Castings (Photo by Han)
description: a sign that earthworms are tilling and fertilising the soil.

name: Snail Shells
description: almost always right-coiled.

name: Sweet Violets
description: distinctively scented native violet, with a candy perfume

name: Herb Robert
description: pink-flowered, red-stemmed, traditionally carried to bring good luck.

name: Pussy Willow
description: pretty silky grey catkins found on goat or grey willow.

name: Hawthorn Leaves
description: lobed leaves emerge before frothy white blooms.

name: Blackthorn (Photo by Han)
description: creamy white flowers appear before leaves. Return in autumn for sloes.

name: Cleavers (Goosegrass) (Photo by Pa)
description: weave the sticky stems to make a primitive strainer for liquids.

name: Dandelion Clock
description: closed seedheads placed in a dry spot open up over time.

name: Wild Garlic
description: pungent early spring leaves and starry white flowers are both edible.

name: Mallard Quills
description: look out for iridescent drake feathers shed after breeding.

name: Hazel Catkins (Photo by B)
description: spot hazel trees in hedgerows and on chalky soils by their golden tassels.

name: Blue Eggshell Fragments
description: from blackbirds, bullfinches, crows, dunnocks, magpies, song thrushes or starlings.

name: White Eggshell Fragments
description: from blue tits, collared doves, goldfinches, great tits, house sparrows or robins.

name: Magnolia Petals
description: pickle edible flowers in rice vinegar and sugar. The flowers are a good source of nectar for pollinators.

name: Fieldstones
description: pushed up by soil freezing and thawing through winter.

name: European Ash Buds
description: black, rounded and in opposite pairs. Get to know your buds.

name: Alder Buds
description: mauve and oblong from a common riverside tree.

name: Chrysalis Cases
description: look under the leaves of butterfly caterpillar feeder plants.

name: Cocoons
description: spun by moth caterpillars to form tough outer pupal shells.

name: Fiddlehead Ferns
description: coiled fronds slowly photosynthesise and strengthen as they unfurl.

name: Cow Parsley
description: frothy white umbels are an early source of nectar for pollinators.
